answer: The Hogwarts Summer School lasts for one week in August at the Renaissance Camp, located in the mountains near Tashkent.
High school students (grades 9-11) and university students (any course) are eligible to apply.
Admissions start in mid-April and run until late May or early June.
The selection process has 3 stages: 1) Essay and CV submission, 2) A case study, 3) Interview with creative questions.
The academic program starts in early March and runs through mid-May with 12 weeks of online sessions following the SPRINT methodology.
Focus areas include Software Technologies, Building Strong Institutions, Ecology, Education, and Education of Concerned Citizens.
Social games include Quidditch Tournaments, Care of Mythical Beasts, and Charms for Collaboration, all during the one-week camp.
The estimated cost per participant is $87. Sponsorship is available, but self-funding may be required if the budget is limited.
Founders include Fahriddin Hayitov, Nargis Kholmamatova, and Fyodor Amanov. They are also acting organizers.
New Uzbekistan University supports the project with expert mentors, financial aid, dormitories, transportation, and more.
